latestPosts.caption:
Lemon Creams with Grapefruit Salsa​

Zesty, creamy, and sunshine-ready — these Lemon Creams are served in our Petite Casseroles in Caribbean, now on sale at upto 40% 🍋​

Makes: 4​

Prep Time: 20 mins​

Setting Time: 3 hrs​

Ingredients for the Lemon Creams​
 500ml double thick cream​
 125g castor sugar​
 1 large lemon, zest and juice​

Ingredients for the Grapefruit Salsa​
 1 large pink grapefruit, peeled and finely chopped (segments only, no pith)​
 1 tsp honey ​

1 lemon zested​
 A few mint leaves, finely chopped 

Method​

1. Make the Lemon Creams​
 Place the cream and sugar in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir gently and bring to a gentle boil.​
 Boil for 3 minutes, then remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly.​

Add the lemon juice and zest, and whisk well. The mixture will thicken slightly.​
 Pour into Le Creuset petit casseroles or bowls and refrigerate for 3 hours until set.​

2. Make the Grapefruit Salsa​
 While the creams set, prepare the grapefruit: segment it over a bowl to catch juices, then finely chop the pieces.​
 Stir in honey, lemon zest, and mint. ​

3. To Serve​
 Top the chilled lemon creams with a spoonful of grapefruit salsa just before serving.​

#LeCreuset #LeCreusetIndia #FrenchCookware #LeCreusetLegacy  #CookingEssentials #CelebrateandShine #KitchenEssentials

latestPosts.caption:
One Pot Sundried Tomato Pasta with Creamy Ricotta​
​
The tart and tangy flavour of sundried tomatoes seamlessly blends with the creaminess of ricotta in this one-pot pasta, making it the ultimate comfort food. 🍝​
​
Serving: 6​
Preparation time: 15 minutes​
Cooking time: 15 minutes​
​
Ingredients:​
​
200g of sundried tomatoes (1 jar)​
2 small shallots, sliced​
500g of shortcut pasta (we’ve used rigatoni)​
1 cup ricotta cheese​
2 tablespoons lemon juice​
10g basil, chopped​
10g parsley, chopped​
750ml waSalt and pepper to taste​
5-7 cherry tomatoes, chopped ​
​​
Method:​​
​​
1. Drain the oil from the sun-dried tomato jar into a Le Creuset Cast Iron 22cm Round Casserole.​​
2. Chop the sun-dried tomatoes.​​
3. Add the shallots to the casserole and cook for 2 minutes over medium heat.​​
4. Stir in the sun-dried tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook until they​​
turn deep red and crispy.​​
5. Add the water to the casserole and then add the pasta.​​
6. Allow the pasta to boil over high heat until it is cooked.​​
7. Once cooked, add a squeeze of lemon and stir in half of the ricotta.​​
8. Add the herbs and stir again.​​
9. Top with the remaining ricotta and garnish with the chopped cherry tomatoes and more herbs.​​

#LeCreuset #LeCreusetIndia #FrenchCookware #LeCreusetLegacy  #CookingEssentials #CelebrateandShine #KitchenEssentials

latestPosts.caption:
Need a simple yet satisfying dinner recipe? 💭 This comforting Sausage Pasta can easily be whipped up in just 35 minutes, making it perfect for busy weeknights. ​
​
Serves: 4-6 ​
Preparation Time: 15 minutes ​
Cooking Time: 20 minutes ​
Difficulty: Easy ​
​
Ingredients ​
​
600g pork sausages ​
15ml oil ​
500 grams Casarecce pasta (or pasta of choice) ​
375ml cream ​
500ml chicken stock OR 125ml white wine and 125ml chicken stock ​
2 garlic cloves, grated ​
Salt and pepper to taste ​
Grated parmesan (optional) ​
Parsley (optional) ​
​
Method ​
​
Remove the casings from the sausage. ​
​
Cook the pasta to your preferred doneness in a Le Creuset 3-Ply Stainless Steel 20cm Pasta Pot. ​
​
Heat the oil in a Le Creuset Signature Stainless Steel 24cm Sauté Pan with Lid and fry the sausage until lightly browned; season with salt and pepper. ​
​
Add the garlic, followed by the stock (or white wine mixture) and cream. ​
​
Reduce until slightly thickened, add the cooked pasta and a little pasta water. Mix until combined. ​
​
Serve as is or with grated parmesan and parsley. ​
​
📸: @clairejoycooks​

​
#LeCreuset #LeCreusetIndia #FrenchCookware #LeCreusetLegacy  #CookingEssentials #CelebrateandShine #KitchenEssentials

Garnet and Chambray aren't just colorways — they're statements.

Garnet brings a sense of quiet luxury. Its deep, wine-toned richness anchors a space, adding depth and warmth to both classic and modern interiors. 

Chambray, on the other hand, is effortlessly composed. This soft, slate blue cools the room with elegance pairing seamlessly with neutral palettes, matte textures, and natural light.

Together, they create a layered aesthetic — bold and restrained, warm and cool — a visual dialogue that elevates any kitchen into a thoughtfully curated space.

A perfect pairing for every kitchen mood ​

Explore the allure of both in-store or online. Link in bio. 💙​

latestPosts.caption:
Sleek, strong, and seriously versatile.​

Engineered for precision and built to last, our Stainless Steel  features rapid, even heating with its triple-layer construction. It is perfect for everyday meals and professional-level performance.​

Sesame Butter Chicken​

Golden, glossy, and full of flavour; this Sesame Butter Chicken is made to shine in our Signature Stainless Steel Frying Pan! 🍳​

Serves: 4​

Prep time: 15 mins​

Cook time: 25 mins​

Ingredients​

500g boneless & skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces​

1 tbsp oil ​

20g butter​

1 tsp garlic powder​

1 tsp grated ginger​

2 tbsp butter chicken spice (or combine 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, ½ tsp paprika, ½ tsp chilli powder)​

½ tsp salt and pepper​

1 onion, diced​

1½ tbsp tahini (or sesame paste)​

1 tsp soy sauce​

2 tbsp tomato paste or ½ cup passata​

250ml cream​

1 tbsp butter​

Toasted sesame seeds and coriander, for garnish​

Cooked rice or naan, to serve​

​Method ​

1. Season & sear the chicken ​
Add the chicken pieces to a medium bowl and add the garlic powder and seasoning and mix well. Heat oil and butter in a pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and sear until browned on all sides. Remove and set aside. ​

2. Make the sauce​​
In the same pan, reduce heat to medium. Add the onion and sauté for a few minutes until softened. Then add the spices, garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the tomato paste, cream, butter, tahini and soy sauce. Mix until smooth and simmer gently for 3–4 minutes.​​

3. Return the chicken​​
Add the chicken back to the pan. Simmer for 10–12 minutes until cooked through and the sauce is thick and glossy.​​

4. Serve​​

Top with toasted sesame seeds and chopped coriander. Serve with rice or warm naan.​​
